Subjective: Irritated left eye since Tuesday morning upon waking; now starting in right eye. Sensation of foreign body ('hair' or 'dust'). Redness and swelling ('thicker than the other eye'). Eye 'a bit stuck' in the morning. Pain only on squeezing eyes shut hard. Negatives: No vision changes, no photophobia, no significant pain, no trauma, no new cosmetics, no contact lens use. No systemic illness/flu. First time with eye issue. Social: Has a young daughter; boyfriend is away. ICE: Worried it's contagious or something serious; requests check-up and advice on drops/antibiotics.
Objective: Eyes: Bilateral conjunctival redness noted. No foreign body seen on lower or upper eyelid eversion. Eyelashes appear normal. Pupils are reactive to light.
Assessment: Inflammation of the surface layer of the eye, consistent with viral conjunctivitis.
Plan: 1. Explanation: Viral cause, self-limiting, may take up to 2 weeks to resolve. 2. Treatment: Artificial tears (OTC) as needed for soothing. 3. Advice: Avoid rubbing. May clean stuck eyelids with lukewarm tap water. 4. Safety Net: Return immediately for increased pain, pus, vision changes, or if eye becomes more stuck shut. 5. Follow-up: Return in 2 weeks if not resolved.
